title: Client + loading screen opening extremely slow
body:
Hey,

So ever since I'm playing on my current laptop I'm having a problem where it takes way too long for the client to open (when starting, when clicking "Launch") and where I have a big delay when waiting for the loading screen. It takes really long to open the loading screen and then it'll take anything between 5-30 (sometimes even more) seconds until I can see all players and start actual loading.
My laptop's slow and certainly not made for gaming, but I don't have such problems with any other games or most applications I use and it's quite annoying to me. In Game my performance is just fine and my fps normally stay between 55-60fps on highest settings.
The old laptop I used before was from 2008, had several technical problems, was super slow when in the actual loading screen, but I got into the client and loading screen way faster and quite normally with it. 

Do you have any idea what I could do to have the client load and loading screen appear faster and without this weird kind of delay?

Any help is appreciated. :)

This are the basic specs of this slow ass laptop:
i5-4210U CPU @1,70Ghz
4GB RAM
Nvidia Geforce 520M GT 
(feelsbadman, but man I can play Borderlands 2 fluently, so why I can't load the lol client properly? ._.)

Greetings 
NichtHurz

replies.body: The graphics card is the thing, Borderlands 2 runs on cpu power and you have that, but the graphics card is bad and cant load a whole game in a little time...
Well, problem solved. I've managed to fix my desktop pc and can outrun most people with my loading speed. :D (This thread is more than a year old btw)
Did you fix it after all? I have the same exact problem and im pretty sure its not a connection issue.

When you perform actions like launching the client or loading the game, your are also establishing a connection to that specific server. There could be other issues causing this, but my bet is that this is a network issue that's failing to maintain a strong connection, which is needed to download game assets.  I suggest using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide, and going through each step to rule out possibilities.  Hopefully, this does the trick!

I actually don't believe it's gotta do with connection issues, since I've had the same kind problem in my shared flat with stable LAN, a friends place with WLAN and my parents house with LAN and WLAN. The ping I've had with these connections always was between 20-45ms ping (general WLAN problems not included).
It might have to do with too low amounts of RAM if it's a hardware problem (as said, my laptop's not too fast), but I've never had any comparable probems with other online games I play.

I'll check the connection issues guide, but I don't believe it'll help. Maybe I just have to get a proper gaming pc again :p .
